title: SinglestoreDB Cloud Overview
description:
## SingleStoreDB Cloud

This dashboard provides a high-level view of your SingleStoreDB metrics and can help you troubleshoot performance issues.

definition.content:
This dashboard provides a high-level view of your SingleStoreDB Cloud metrics and helps you observe:
- Any issues due to resource utilization
- Spikes in connections
- A high-level overview of query rate & performance

For further reading on SingleStore:
- [SingleStore docs](https://docs.singlestore.com/)
Changes in the pattern of the above throughput metrics from the historical norm may indicate an issue with your application or changes in your workload.

Number of open connections (threads_connected) to the database relative to the maximum limit (max_connections). If the utilization is near 100%, it means the DB is approaching the maximum allowed connections. This can potentially lead to performance issues, as queries may need to wait in a queue until a thread becomes available to process them.

Number of threads actively running queries (threads_running) relative to the maximum limit (max_connection_threads). If the utilization is near 100%, it suggests that the system might be reaching its capacity in terms of how many queries can be executed in parallel. This situation can lead to resource pressure, unresponsiveness, latency spikes, and even failures

Number of connections with pending queries that are waiting to be associated with available threads for execution. Increase in ready_queue means queries are queuing up faster than they can be executed by the available threads and potentially causing delays in query execution.
The number of successful or non-successful connection attempts per second to the server.
The number of failed attempts to connect to the server.
